title: Abolish the lame-duck period? | Today, Explained in 10
description:
America’s two-month lame-duck period gave supporters of the outgoing president ample time to plan a violent uprising. Vox’s Ian Millhiser argues the long transition needs to end.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
itunes:title: Abolish the lame-duck period? | Today, Explained in 10
itunes:author: Vox
itunes:subtitle: The lame-duck period is enshrined in the constitution. But as Vox's Ian Millhiser argues, it should still be abolished.
itunes:summary:
